title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The Fed's Powell, in Senate testimony, reaffirmed the central bank's commitment to maintaining easy-money policies until the economy has recovered further from the effects of the coronavirus pandemic.

---

Tech stocks rebounded from an early swoon after Powell's remarks. The Nasdaq ended 0.5% lower after being down as much as 4%. The S&P 500 eked out a 0.1% gain and the Dow edged up 0.05%.

---

Facebook faces continuing battles around the world over how it handles news content after striking an agreement with the Australian government to pay for content.

---

Home Depot has fared better than Macy's during the coronavirus pandemic and both companies say that shopping trends have continued into 2021.

---

The midflight breakdown of a jet engine that spewed debris over a Colorado town is putting regulatory focus on the design and strength of engine coverings.

---

Marriott named insider Tony Capuano to be its new chief executive, picking a longtime veteran of the hotel company for the post.

---

The financial future of Petrobras hung in the balance as its board moved forward with plans to approve Bolsonaro's pick of an army general to lead the company.

---

Jeff Blackburn, a top Amazon executive and close aide to Bezos, is leaving the company after taking a yearlong sabbatical.
